verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:20
verses.text: After them there is now given to the same completed Churches the comfort of having the prophetic Scriptures subsequently interpreted, for I said that after the apostles there would be interpreting prophets.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:21
verses.text: For the apostle says: "And he placed in the Church indeed, first, apostles; secondly, prophets; thirdly, teachers," and the rest.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:22
verses.text: And in another place he says: "Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the others judge".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:23
verses.text: And he says: "Every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered, dishonoureth her head".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:24
verses.text: And when he says, "Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the others judge," he is not speaking in respect of the Catholic prophecy of things unheard and unknown, but of things both announced and known.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:25
verses.text: But let them judge whether or not the interpretation is consistent with the testimonies of the prophetic utterance.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:26
verses.text: It is plain, therefore, that to John, armed as he was with superior virtue, this was not necessary, although the body of Christ, which is the Church, adorned with His members, ought to respond to its position.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:27
verses.text: "I took the book from the hand of the angel, and ate it up".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:28
verses.text: To take the book and eat it up, is, when exhibition of a thing is made to one, to commit it to memory.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:29
verses.text: "And it was in my mouth as sweet as honey".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:30
verses.text: To be sweet in the mouth is the reward of the preaching of the speaker, and is most pleasant to the hearers; but it is most bitter both to those that announce it, and to those that persevere in its commandments through suffering.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:31
verses.text: "And He says unto me, Thou must again prophesy to the peoples, and to the tongues, and to the nations, and to many kings".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:32
verses.text: He says this, because when John said these things he was in the island of Patmos, condemned to the labour of the mines by Caesar Domitian.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:33
verses.text: There, therefore, he saw the Apocalypse; and when grown old, he thought that he should at length receive his quittance by suffering, Domitian being killed, all his judgments were discharged.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:34
verses.text: And John being dismissed from the mines, thus subsequently delivered the same Apocalypse which he had received from God.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 10:35
verses.text: This, therefore, is what He says: Thou must again prophesy to all nations, because thou seest the crowds of Antichrist rise up; and against them other crowds shall stand, and they shall fall by the sword on the one side and on the other.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:1
verses.text: from the eleventh chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:2
verses.text: "And there was shown unto me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:3
verses.text: A reed was shown like to a rod.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:4
verses.text: This itself is the Apocalypse which he subsequently exhibited to the churches; for the Gospel of the complete faith he subsequently wrote for the sake of our salvation.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:5
verses.text: For when Valentinus, and Cerinthus, and Ebion, and others of the school of Satan, were scattered abroad throughout the world, there assembled together to him from the neighbouring provinces all the bishops, and compelled him himself also to draw up his testimony.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:6
verses.text: Moreover, we say that the measure of God's temple is the command of God to confess the Father Almighty, and that His Son Christ was begotten by the Father before the beginning of the world, and was made man in very soul and flesh, both of them having overcome misery and death; and that, when received with His body into heaven by the Father, He shed forth the Holy Spirit, the gift and pledge of immortality, that He was announced by the prophets, He was described by the law, He was God's hand, and the Word of the Father from God, Lord over all, and founder of the world: this is the reed and the measure of faith; and no one worships the holy altar save he who confesses this faith.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:7
verses.text: "The court which is within the temple leave out".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:8
verses.text: The space which is called the court is the empty altar within the walls: these being such as were not necessary, he commanded to be ejected from the Church.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:9
verses.text: "It is given to be trodden down by the Gentiles".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:10
verses.text: That is, to the men of this world, that it may be trodden under foot by the nations, or with the nations.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:11
verses.text: Then he repeats about the destruction and slaughter of the last time, and says:—.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:12
verses.text: "They shall tread the holy city down for forty and two months; and I will give to my two witnesses, and they shall predict a thousand two hundred and threescore days clothed in sackcloth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:13
verses.text: That is, three years and six months: these make forty-two months.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:14
verses.text: Therefore their preaching is three years and six months, and the kingdom of Antichrist as much again.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:15
verses.text: "If any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:16
verses.text: That fire proceedeth out of the mouth of those prophets against the adversaries, bespeaks the power of the world.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:17
verses.text: For all afflictions, however many there are, shall be sent by their messengers in their word.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:18
verses.text: Many think that there is Elisha, or Moses, with Elijah; but both of these died; while the death of Elijah is not heard of, with whom all our ancients have believed that it was Jeremiah.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:19
verses.text: For even the very word spoken to him testifies to him, saying, "Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:20
verses.text: But he was not a prophet unto the nations; and thus the truthful word of God makes it necessary, which it has promised to set forth, that he should be a prophet to the nations.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:21
verses.text: "These are the two candlesticks standing before the Lord of the earth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:22
verses.text: These two candlesticks and two olive trees He has to this end spoken of, and admonished you that if, when you have read of them elsewhere, you have not understood, you may understand here.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:23
verses.text: For in Zechariah, one of the twelve prophets, it is thus written: "These are the two olive trees and two candlesticks which stand in the presence of the Lord of the earth;" that is, they are in paradise.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:24
verses.text: Also, in another sense, standing in the presence of the lord of the earth, that is, in the presence of Antichrist.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:25
verses.text: Therefore they must be slain by Antichrist.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:26
verses.text: "And the beast which ascendeth from the abyss".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:27
verses.text: After many plagues completed in the world, in the end he says that a beast ascended from the abyss.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:28
verses.text: But that he shall ascend from the abyss is proved by many testimonies; for he says in the thirty-first chapter of Ezekiel: "Behold, Assur was a cypress in Mount Lebanon".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:29
verses.text: Assur, deeply rooted, was a lofty and branching cypress—that is, a numerous people—in Mount Lebanon, in the kingdom of kingdoms, that is, of the Romans.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:30
verses.text: Moreover, that he says he was beautiful in offshoots, he says he was strong in armies.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:31
verses.text: The water, he says, shall nourish him, that is, the many thousands of men which were subjected to him; and the abyss increased him, that is, belched him forth.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:32
verses.text: For even Isaiah speaks almost in the same words; moreover, that he was in the kingdom of the Romans, and that he was among the Caesars.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:33
verses.text: The Apostle Paul also bears witness, for he says to the Thessalonians: "Let him who now restraineth restrain, until he be taken out of the way; and then shall appear that Wicked One, even he whose coming is after the working of Satan, with signs and lying wonders".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:34
verses.text: And that they might know that he should come who then was the prince, he added: "He already endeavours after the secret of mischief"—that is, the mischief which he is about to do he strives to do secretly; but he is not raised up by his own power, nor by that of his father, but by command of God, of which thing Paul says in the same passage: "For this cause, because they have not received the love of God, He will send upon them a spirit of error, that they all may be persuaded of a lie, who have not been persuaded of the truth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:35
verses.text: And Isaiah saith: "While they waited for the light, darkness arose upon them".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:36
verses.text: Therefore the Apocalypse sets forth that these prophets are killed by the same, and on the fourth day rise again, that none might be found equal to God.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:37
verses.text: "And their dead bodies shall lie in the streets of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:38
verses.text: But He calls Jerusalem Sodom and Egypt, since it had become the heaping up of the persecuting people.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:39
verses.text: Therefore it behooves us diligently, and with the utmost care, to follow the prophetic announcement, and to understand what the Spirit from the Father both announces and anticipates, and how, when He has gone forward to the last times, He again repeats the former ones.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:40
verses.text: And now, what He will do once for all, He sometimes sets forth as if it were done; and unless you understand this, as sometimes done, and sometimes as about to be done, you will fall into a great confusion.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:41
verses.text: Therefore the interpretation of the following sayings has shown therein, that not the order of the reading, but the order of the discourse, must be understood.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:42
verses.text: "And the temple of God was opened which is in heaven".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:43
verses.text: The temple opened is a manifestation of our Lord.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:44
verses.text: For the temple of God is the Son, as He Himself says: "Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:45
verses.text: And when the Jews said, "Forty and six years was this temple in building," the evangelist says, "He spake of the temple of His body".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:46
verses.text: "And there was seen in His temple the ark of the Lord's testament".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 11:47
verses.text: The preaching of the Gospel and the forgiveness of sins, and all the gifts whatever that came with Him, he says, appeared therein.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:1
verses.text: from the twelfth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:2
verses.text: "And there was seen a great sign in heaven.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:3
verses.text: A woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:4
verses.text: And being with child, she cried out travailing, and bearing torments that she might bring forth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:5
verses.text: The woman clothed with the sun, and having the moon under her feet, and wearing a crown of twelve stars upon her head, and travailing in her pains, is the ancient Church of fathers, and prophets, and saints, and apostles, which had the groans and torments of its longing until it saw that Christ, the fruit of its people according to the flesh long promised to it, had taken flesh out of the selfsame people.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:6
verses.text: Moreover, being clothed with the sun intimates the hope of resurrection and the glory of the promise.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:7
verses.text: And the moon intimates the fall of the bodies of the saints under the obligation of death, which never can fail.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:8
verses.text: For even as life is diminished, so also it is increased.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:9
verses.text: Nor is the hope of those that sleep extinguished absolutely, as some think, but they have in their darkness a light such as the moon.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:10
verses.text: And the crown of twelve stars signifies the choir of fathers, according to the fleshly birth, of whom Christ was to take flesh.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:11
verses.text: "And there appeared another sign in heaven; and behold a red dragon, having seven heads".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:12
verses.text: Now, that he says that this dragon was of a red colour—that is, of a purple colour—the result of his work gave him such a colour.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:13
verses.text: For from the beginning (as the Lord says) he was a murderer; and he has oppressed the whole of the human race, not so much by the obligation of death, as, moreover, by the various forms of destruction and fatal mischiefs.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:14
verses.text: His seven heads were the seven kings of the Romans, of whom also is Antichrist, as we have said above.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:15
verses.text: "And ten horns".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:16
verses.text: He says that the ten kings in the latest times are the same as these, as we shall more fully set forth there.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:17
verses.text: "And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and cast them upon the earth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:18
verses.text: Now, that he says that the dragon's tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, this may be taken in two ways.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:19
verses.text: For many think that he may be able to seduce the third part of the men who believe.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:20
verses.text: But it should more truly be understood, that of the angels that were subject to him, since he was still a prince when he descended from his estate, he seduced the third part; therefore what we said above, the Apocalypse says.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:21
verses.text: "And the dragon stood before the woman who was beginning to bring forth, that, when she had brought forth, he might devour her child".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:22
verses.text: The red dragon standing and desiring to devour her child when she had brought him forth, is the devil,—to wit, the traitor angel, who thought that the perishing of all men would be alike by death; but He, who was not born of seed, owed nothing to death: wherefore he could not devour Him—that is, detain Him in death—for on the third day He rose again.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:23
verses.text: Finally, also, and before He suffered, he approached to tempt Him as man; but when he found that He was not what he thought Him to be, he departed from Him, even till the time.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:24
verses.text: Whence it is here said:—.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:25
verses.text: "And she brought forth a son, who begins to rule all nations with a rod of iron".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:26
verses.text: The rod of iron is the sword of persecution.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:27
verses.text: "I saw that all men withdrew from his abodes".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:28
verses.text: That is, the good will be removed, flying from persecution.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:29
verses.text: "And her son was caught up to God, and to His throne".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:30
verses.text: We read also in the Acts of the Apostles that He was caught up to God's throne, just as speaking with the disciples He was caught up to heaven.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:31
verses.text: "But the woman fled into the wilderness, and there were given to her two great eagle's wings".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:32
verses.text: The aid of the great eagle's wings—to wit, the gift of prophets—was given to that Catholic Church, whence in the last times a hundred and forty-four thousands of men should believe on the preaching of Elias; but, moreover, he here says that the rest of the people should be found alive on the coming of the Lord.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:33
verses.text: And the Lord says in the Gospel: "Then let them which are in Judea flee to the mountains;" that is, as many as should be gathered together in Judea, let them go to that place which they have ready, and let them be supported there for three years and six months from the presence of the devil.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:34
verses.text: "Two great wings" are the two prophets—Elias, and the prophet who shall be with him.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:35
verses.text: "And the serpent cast out of his mouth after the woman water as a flood, that he might carry her away with the flood".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:36
verses.text: He signifies by the water which the serpent cast out of his mouth, the people who at his command would persecute her.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:37
verses.text: "And the earth helped the woman, and opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:38
verses.text: That the earth opened her month and swallowed up the waters, sets forth the vengeance for the present troubles.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:39
verses.text: Although, therefore, it may signify this woman bringing forth, it shows her afterwards flying when her offspring is brought forth, because both things did not happen at one time; for we know that Christ was born, but that the time should arrive that she should flee from the face of the serpent: (we do not know) that this has happened as yet.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:40
verses.text: Then he says:—  –.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:41
verses.text: "There was a battle in heaven: Michael and his angels fought with the dragon; and the dragon warred, and his angels, and they prevailed not; nor was their place found any more in heaven.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:42
verses.text: And that great dragon was cast forth, that old serpent: he was cast forth into the earth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:43
verses.text: This is the beginning of Antichrist; yet previously Elias must prophesy, and there must be times of peace.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:44
verses.text: And afterwards, when the three years and six months are completed in the preaching of Elias, he also must be cast down from heaven, where up till that time he had had the power of ascending; and all the apostate angels, as well as Antichrist, must be roused up from hell.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 12:45
verses.text: Paul the apostle says: "Except there come a falling away first, and the man of sin shall appear, the son of perdition; and the adversary who exalted himself above all which is called God, or which is worshipped".

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:1
verses.text: from the thirteenth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:2
verses.text: "And I saw a beast rising up from the sea, like unto a leopard".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:3
verses.text: This signifies the kingdom of that time of Antichrist, and the people mingled with the variety of nations.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:4
verses.text: "His feet were as the feet of a bear".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:5
verses.text: A strong and most unclean beast, the feet are to be understood as his leaders.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:6
verses.text: "And his mouth as the mouth of a lion".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 13:7
verses.text: That is, his mouth armed for blood is his bidding, and a tongue which will proceed to nothing else than to the shedding of blood.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:1
verses.text: "His number is the name of a man, and his number is Six hundred threescore and six".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:2
verses.text: As they have it reckoned from the Greek characters, they thus find it among many to be τειταν, for τειταν has this number, which the Gentiles call Sol and Phoebus; and it is reckoned in Greek thus: τ three hundred, ε five, ι ten, τ three hundred, α one, ν fifty,—which taken together become six hundred and sixty-six.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:3
verses.text: For as far as belongs to the Greek letters, they fill up this number and name; which name if you wish to turn into Latin, it is understood by the antiphrase DICLUX, which letters are reckoned in this manner: since D figures five hundred, I one, C a hundred, L fifty, V five, X ten,—which by the reckoning up of the letters makes similarly six hundred and sixty-six, that is, what in Greek gives τειταν, to wit, what in Latin is called DICLUX; by which name, expressed by antiphrases, we understand Antichrist, who, although he be cut off from the supernal light, and deprived thereof, yet transforms himself into an angel of light, daring to call himself light.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:4
verses.text: Moreover, we find in a certain Greek codex αντεμος, which letters being reckoned up, you will find to give the number as above: α one, ν fifty, τ three hundred, ε five, μ forty, ο seventy, ς two hundred,—which together makes six hundred and sixty-six, according to the Greeks.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:5
verses.text: Moreover, there is another name in Gothic of him, which will be evident of itself, that is, γενσήρικος, which in the same way you will reckon in Greek letters: γ three, ε five, ν fifty, σ two hundred, η eight, ρ a hundred, ι ten, κ twenty, ο seventy, ς also two hundred, which, as has been said above, make six hundred and sixty-six.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:6
verses.text: "And I saw another beast coming up out of the earth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:7
verses.text: He is speaking of the great and false prophet who is to do signs, and portents, and falsehoods before him in the presence of men.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:8
verses.text: "And he had two horns like a lamb—that is, the appearance within of a man—and he spoke like a dragon".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:9
verses.text: But the devil speaks full of malice; for he shall do these things in the presence of men, so that even the dead appear to rise again.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:10
verses.text: "And he shall make fire come down from heaven in the sight of men".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:11
verses.text: Yes (as I also have said), in the sight of men.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:12
verses.text: Magicians do these things, by the aid of the apostate angels, even to this day.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:13
verses.text: He shall cause also that a golden image of Antichrist shall be placed in the temple at Jerusalem, and that the apostate angel should enter, and thence utter voices and oracles.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:14
verses.text: Moreover, he himself shall contrive that his servants and children should receive as a mark on their foreheads, or on their right hands, the number of his name, lest any one should buy or sell them.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:15
verses.text: Daniel had previously predicted his contempt and provocation of God.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:16
verses.text: "And he shall place," says he, "his temple within Samaria, upon the illustrious and holy mountain that is at Jerusalem, an image such as Nebuchadnezzar had made".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:17
verses.text: Thence here he places, and by and by here he renews, that of which the Lord, admonishing His churches concerning the last times and their dangers, says: "But when ye shall see the contempt which is spoken of by Daniel the prophet standing in the holy place, let him who readeth understand".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:18
verses.text: It is called a contempt when God is provoked, because idols are worshipped instead of God, or when the dogma of heretics is introduced in the churches.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 20:19
verses.text: But it is a turning away because stedfast men, seduced by false signs and portents, are turned away from their salvation.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:1
verses.text: from the fourteenth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:2
verses.text: "And I saw an angel flying through the midst of heaven".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:3
verses.text: The angel flying through the midst of heaven, whom he says that he saw, we have already treated of above, as being the same Elias who anticipates the kingdom of Antichrist in his prophecy.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:4
verses.text: "And another angel following him".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:5
verses.text: The other angel following, he speaks of as the same prophet who is the associate of his prophesying.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:6
verses.text: But that he says,—.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:7
verses.text: "Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather in the grapes of the vine," he signifies it of the nations that should perish on the advent of the Lord.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:8
verses.text: And indeed in many forms he shows this same thing, as if to the dry harvest, and the seed for the coming of the Lord, and the consummation of the world, and the kingdom of Christ, and the future appearance of the kingdom of the blessed.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:9
Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:10
verses.text: "And the angel thrust in the sickle, and reaped the vine of the earth, and cast it into the wine-press of the wrath of God.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:11
verses.text: And the wine-press of His fury was trodden down without the city".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:12
verses.text: In that he says that it was cast into the wine-press of the wrath of God, and trodden down without the city, the treading of the wine-press is the retribution on the sinner.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:13
verses.text: "And blood went out from the wine-press, even unto the horse-bridles".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:14
verses.text: The vengeance of shed blood as was before predicted, "In blood thou hast sinned, and blood shall follow thee".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:15
verses.text: "For a thousand and six hundred furlongs".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:16
verses.text: That is, through all the four parts of the world: for there is a quadrate put together by fours, as in four faces and four appearances, and wheels by fours; for forty times four is one thousand six hundred.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 21:17
verses.text: Repeating the same persecution, the Apocalypse says:—.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:1
verses.text: from the fifteenth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:2
verses.text: "And I saw another great and wonderful sign, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is completed the indignation of God".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:3
verses.text: For the wrath of God always strikes the obstinate people with seven plagues, that is, perfectly, as it is said in Leviticus; and these shall be in the last time, when the Church shall have gone out of the midst.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:4
verses.text: "Standing upon the sea of glass, having harps".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:5
verses.text: That is, that they stood stedfastly in the faith upon their baptism, and having their confession in their mouth, that they shall exult in the kingdom before God.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 22:6
verses.text: But let us return to what is set before us.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:1
verses.text: from the seventeenth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:2
Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:3
verses.text: "There came one of the seven angels, which have the seven bowls, and spake with me, saying, Come, I will show thee the judgment of that great whore who sitteth upon many waters.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:4
verses.text: And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the martyrs".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:5
verses.text: The decrees of that senate are always accomplished against all, contrary to the preaching of the true faith; and now already mercy being cast aside, itself here gave the decree among all nations.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:6
verses.text: "And I saw the woman herself sitting upon the scarlet-coloured beast, full of names of blasphemy".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:7
verses.text: But to sit upon the scarlet beast, the author of murders, is the image of the devil.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:8
verses.text: Where also is treated of his captivity, concerning which we have fully considered.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:9
verses.text: I remember, indeed, that this is called Babylon also in the Apocalypse, on account of confusion; and in Isaiah also; and Ezekiel called it Sodom.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:10
verses.text: In fine, if you compare what is said against Sodom, and what Isaiah says against Babylon, and what the Apocalypse says, you will find that they are all one.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:11
verses.text: "The seven heads are the seven hills, on which the woman sitteth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:12
verses.text: That is, the city of Rome.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:13
verses.text: "And there are seven kings: five have fallen, and one is, and the other is not yet come; and when he is come, he will be for a short time".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:14
verses.text: The time must be understood in which the written Apocalypse was published, since then reigned Caesar Domitian; but before him had been Titus his brother, and Vespasian, Otho, Vitellius, and Galba.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:15
verses.text: These are the five who have fallen.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:16
verses.text: One remains, under whom the Apocalypse was written—Domitian, to wit.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:17
verses.text: "The other has not yet come," speaks of Nerva; "and when he is come, he will be for a short time," for he did not complete the period of two years.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:18
verses.text: "And the beast which thou sawest is of the seven".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:19
verses.text: Since before those kings Nero reigned.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:20
verses.text: "And he is the eighth".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:21
verses.text: He says only when this beast shall come, reckon it the eighth place, since in that is the completion.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:22
verses.text: He added:—  "And shall go into perdition".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:23
verses.text: For that ten kings received royal power when he shall move from the east, he says.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:24
verses.text: He shall be sent from the city of Rome with his armies.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:25
verses.text: And Daniel sets forth the ten horns and the ten diadems.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:26
verses.text: And that these are eradicated from the former ones,—that is, that three of the principal leaders are killed by Antichrist: that the other seven give him honour and wisdom and power, of whom he says:—.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:27
verses.text: "These shall hate the whore, to wit, the city, and shall burn her flesh with fire".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:28
verses.text: Now that one of the heads was, as it were, slain to death, and that the stroke of his death was directed, he speaks of Nero.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:29
verses.text: For it is plain that when the cavalry sent by the senate was pursuing him, he himself cut his throat.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:30
verses.text: Him therefore, when raised up, God will send as a worthy king, but worthy in such a way as the Jews merited.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:31
verses.text: And since he is to have another name, He shall also appoint another name, that so the Jews may receive him as if he were the Christ.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:32
verses.text: Says Daniel: "He shall not know the lust of women, although before he was most impure, and he shall know no God of his fathers: for he will not be able to seduce the people of the circumcision, unless he is a judge of the law".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:33
verses.text: Finally, also, he will recall the saints, not to the worship of idols, but to undertake circumcision, and, if he is able, to seduce any; for he shall so conduct himself as to be called Christ by them.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 23:34
verses.text: But that he rises again from hell, we have said above in the word of Isaiah: "Water shall nourish him, and hell hath increased him;" who, however, must come with name unchanged, and doings unchanged, as says the Spirit.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 24

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 24:1
verses.text: from the nineteenth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 24:2
verses.text: "And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that sat upon him was called Faithful and True".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 24:3
verses.text: The horse, and He that sits upon him, sets forth our Lord coming to His kingdom with the heavenly army.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 24:4
verses.text: Because from the sea of the north, which is the Arabian Sea, even to the sea of Phoenice, and even to the ends of the earth, they will command these greater parts in the coming of the Lord Jesus, and all the souls of the nations will be assembled to judgment.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:1
verses.text: from the twentieth chapter.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:2
Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:3
verses.text: "And I saw an angel come down from heaven, having the key of the abyss, and a chain in his hand.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:4
verses.text: And he held the dragon, that old serpent, which is called the Devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years, and cast him into the abyss, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be finished: after this he must be loosed a little season".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:5
verses.text: Those years wherein Satan is bound are in the first advent of Christ, even to the end of the age; and they are called a thousand, according to that mode of speaking, wherein a part is signified by the whole, just as is that passage, "the word which He commanded for a thousand generations," although they are not a thousand.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:6
verses.text: Moreover that he says, "and he cast him into the abyss," he says this, because the devil, excluded from the hearts of believers, began to take possession of the wicked, in whose hearts, blinded day by day, he is shut up as if in a profound abyss.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:7
verses.text: And he shut him up, says he, and put a seal upon him, that he should not deceive the nations until the thousand years should be finished.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:8
verses.text: "He shut the door upon him," it is said, that is, he forbade and restrained his seducing those who belong to Christ.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:9
verses.text: Moreover, he put a seal upon him, because it is hidden who belong to the side of the devil, and who to that of Christ.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:10
verses.text: For we know not of those who seem to stand whether they shall not fall, and of those who are down it is uncertain whether they may rise.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:11
verses.text: Moreover, that he says that he is bound and shut up, that he may not seduce the nations, the nations signify the Church, seeing that of them it itself is formed, and which being seduced, he previously held until, he says, the thousand years should be completed, that is, what is left of the sixth day, to wit, of the sixth age, which subsists for a thousand years; after this he must be loosed for a little season.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:12
verses.text: The little season signifies three years and six months, in which with all his power the devil will avenge himself under Antichrist against the Church.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:13
verses.text: Finally, he says, after that the devil shall be loosed, and will seduce the nations in the whole world, and will entice war against the Church, the number of whose foes shall be as the sand of the sea.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:14
Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:15
verses.text: "And I saw thrones, and them that sat upon them, and judgment was given unto them; and I saw the souls of them that were slain on account of the testimony of Jesus, and for the word of God, and which had not worshipped the beast nor his image, nor have received his writing on their forehead or in their hand; and they reigned with Christ for a thousand years: the rest of them lived not again until the thousand years were finished.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:16
verses.text: This is the first resurrection".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:17
verses.text: There are two resurrections.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:18
verses.text: But the first resurrection is now of the souls that are by the faith, which does not permit men to pass over to the second death.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:19
verses.text: Of this resurrection the apostle says: "If ye have risen with Christ, seek those things which are above".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:20
verses.text: "Blessed and holy is he who has part in this resurrection: on them the second death shall have no power, but they shall be priests of God and Christ, and they shall reign with Him a thousand years".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:21
verses.text: I do not think the reign of a thousand years is eternal; or if it is thus to be thought of, they cease to reign when the thousand years are finished.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:22
verses.text: But I will put forward what my capacity enables me to judge.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:23
verses.text: The tenfold number signifies the decalogue, and the hundredfold sets forth the crown of virginity: for he who shall have kept the undertaking of virginity completely, and shall have faithfully fulfilled the precepts of the decalogue, and shall have destroyed the untrained nature or impure thoughts within the retirement of the heart, that they may not rule over him, this is the true priest of Christ, and accomplishing the millenary number thoroughly, is thought to reign with Christ; and truly in his case the devil is bound.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:24
verses.text: But he who is entangled in the vices and the dogmas of heretics, in his case the devil is loosed.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:25
verses.text: But that it says that when the thousand years are finished he is loosed, so the number of the perfect saints being completed, in whom there is the glory of virginity in body and mind, by the approaching advent of the kingdom of the hateful one, many, seduced by that love of earthly things, shall be overthrown, and together with him shall enter the lake of fire.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:26
Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:27
verses.text: "And they went up upon the breadth of the earth, and compassed the camp of the saints about, and the beloved city; and fire came down from God out of heaven, and devoured them.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:28
verses.text: And the devil who seduced them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where both the beast and the false prophet shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:29
verses.text: This belongs to the last judgment.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 25:30
verses.text: And after a little time the earth was made holy, as being at least that wherein lately had reposed the bodies of the virgins, when they shall enter upon an eternal kingdom with an immortal King, as they who are not only virgins in body, but, moreover, with equal inviolability have protected themselves, both in tongue and thought, from wickedness; and these, it shows, shall dwell in rejoicing for ever with the Lamb.

chapters.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:1
verses.text: from the twenty-first and twenty-second chapters.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:2
verses.text: "And the city is placed in a square".

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:3
verses.text: The city which he says is squared, he says also is resplendent with gold and precious stones, and has a sacred street, and a river through the midst of it, and the tree of life on either side, bearing twelve manner of fruits throughout the twelve months; and that the light of the sun is not there, because the Lamb is the light of it; and that its gates were of single pearls; and that there were three gates on each of the four sides, and that they could not be shut.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:4
verses.text: I say, in respect of the square city, he shows forth the united multitude of the saints, in whom the faith could by no means waver.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:5
verses.text: As Noah is commanded to make the ark of squared beams, that it might resist the force of the deluge, by the precious stones he sets forth the holy men who cannot waver in persecution, who could not be moved either by the tempest of persecutors, or be dissolved from the true faith by the force of the rain, because they are associated of pure gold, of whom the city of the great King is adorned.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:6
verses.text: Moreover, the streets set forth their hearts purified from all uncleanness, transparent with glowing light, that the Lord may justly walk up and down in them.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:7
verses.text: The river of life sets forth that the grace of spiritual doctrine flowed through the minds of the faithful, and that manifold flourishing forms of odours germinated therein.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:8
verses.text: The tree of life on either bank sets forth the Advent of Christ, according to the flesh, who satisfied the peoples wasted with famine, that received life from One by the wood of the Cross, with the announcement of God's word.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:9
verses.text: And in that he says that the sun is not necessary in the city, he shows, evidently, that the Creator as the immaculate light shines in the midst of it, whose brightness no mind has been able to conceive, nor tongue to tell.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:10
verses.text: In that he says there are three gates placed on each of the four sides, of single pearls, I think that these are the four virtues, to wit, prudence, fortitude, justice, temperance, which are associated with one another.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:11
verses.text: And, being involved together, they make the number twelve.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:12
verses.text: But the twelve gates we believe to be the number of the apostles, who, shining in the four virtues as precious stones, manifesting the light of their doctrine among the saints, cause it to enter the celestial city, that by intercourse with them the choir of angels may be gladdened.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:13
verses.text: And that the gates cannot be shut, it is evidently shown that the doctrine of the apostles can be separated from rectitude by no tempest of contradiction.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:14
verses.text: Even though the floods of the nations and the vain superstitions of heretics should revolt against their true faith, they are overcome, and shall be dissolved as the foam, because Christ is the Rock by which, and on which, the Church is founded.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:15
verses.text: And thus it is overcome by no traces of maddened men.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:16
verses.text: Therefore they are not to be heard who assure themselves that there is to be an earthly reign of a thousand years; who think, that is to say, with the heretic Cerinthus.

verses.name: Victorinus: Commentary on the Apocalypse of the Blessed John 26:17
verses.text: For the kingdom of Christ is now eternal in the saints, although the glory of the saints shall be manifested after the resurrection.
